all.title: All repositories
all.desc: Repositories sorted by last pipeline creation

last.title: Last visited
last.desc: Most recently visited repositories sorted by access time

not_found.not_found: Whoa 404, either we broke something or you had a typing mishap :-/

errors.not_found: Server could not find requested object

variables.title: Additional pipeline variables
variables.desc: Specify additional variables to be used in your pipeline. Variables with the same name are overwritten.
variables.name: Variable name

deploy_pipeline.title: Trigger a deployment for current pipeline #{pipelineId}

variables.title: Additional pipeline variables
variables.desc: Specify additional variables to be used in your pipeline. Variables with the same name are overwritten.
variables.name: Variable name

repo.user_none: This organization/user has no projects yet
repo.not_allowed: You are not allowed to access this repository

public.desc: Anyone can see your project without being logged in.

private.desc: Only you and other owners of the repository can see this project.

internal.desc: Only authenticated users of the Woodpecker instance can see this project.

settings.not_allowed: You are not allowed to access the settings of this repository

pipeline_path.desc: Path to your pipeline config (for example {0}). Folders should end with a {1}.

allow_pr.desc: Allow the execution of pipelines on pull requests.

allow_deploy.desc: Allow deployments for successful pipelines. All users with push permissions can trigger these, so use with caution.

netrc_only_trusted.desc: Plugins that get access to netrc credentials that can be used to clone repositories from the forge or push them into the forge.

network.desc: Pipeline containers get access to network privileges like changing DNS.

volumes.desc: Pipeline containers are allowed to mount volumes.

security.desc: Pipeline containers get access to security privileges.

cancel_prev.desc: Selected event triggers cancel pending and running pipelines of the same event before starting the next one.

crons.desc: Cron jobs can be used to trigger pipelines on a regular basis.

delete.confirm:
All data will be lost after this action!

Do you really want to proceed?

pipeline.no_pipelines: No pipelines have been started yet.
pipeline.log_download_error: An error occurred while downloading the log file
pipeline.log_delete_confirm: Do you really want to delete the step logs?
pipeline.log_delete_error: An error occurred when deleting the step logs

protected.awaits: This pipeline is awaiting approval from a maintainer!

debug.title: Debug
debug.no_permission: You are not allowed to access the debug information
debug.metadata_exec_desc: Download the metadata of this pipeline to run it locally. This allows you to fix problems and test changes before committing them. The Woodpecker CLI must be installed locally in the same version as the server.

settings.not_allowed: You are not allowed to access the settings of this organization

secrets.desc: Organization secrets can be used in the pipelines of all repositories owned by the organization.

registries.desc: Organization registry credentials can be added to use private images for all pipelines of an organization.

settings.not_allowed: You are not allowed to access server settings

secrets.desc: Global secrets can be used in the pipelines of all repositories.
secrets.warning: These secrets are available to all users.

registries.desc: Global registry credentials can be added to use private images for all pipelines.
registries.warning: These registry credentials are available to all users.

no_schedule.name: Disable agent
no_schedule.placeholder: Stop agent from taking new tasks

capacity.desc: The maximum amount of parallel pipelines executed by this agent.

custom_labels.desc: The custom labels set by the agent admin on agent startup.

agents.delete_confirm: Do you really want to delete this agent? It will no longer be able to connect to the server.

queue.desc: Tasks waiting to be executed by agents.

users.delete_confirm: Do you really want to delete this user? This will also delete all repositories owned by this user.

orgs.desc: Organizations owning repositories on this server.
orgs.delete_confirm: Do you really want to delete this organization? This will also delete all repositories owned by this organization.

repos.desc: Repositories that are or were activated on this server.

secrets.desc: User secrets can be used in the pipelines of all repositories owned by the user.

registries.desc: User registry credentials can be added to use private images for all personal pipelines.

cli_and_api.desc: Personal Access Token, CLI and API usage

agents.desc: Agents registered to your account repos.

secrets.desc: Secrets can be used in all pipelines of this repository.
secrets.name: Name
secrets.delete_confirm: Do you really want to delete this secret?

plugins.images: Available only for the following plugins
plugins.desc: List of plugin images where this secret is available. Leave empty to allow all plugins and normal steps.

events.warning: Exposing secrets to pull requests could allow bad actors to steal your secrets with a malicious pull request.

registries.desc: Registry credentials can be added to use private images for pipelines.
registries.none: There are no registry credentials yet.
registries.delete_confirm: Do you really want to delete this registry?

update_woodpecker: Please update your Woodpecker instance to {0}
login_to_cli_description: If you continue, you will be logged in to the CLI.
return_to_cli: You can now close this tab and return to the CLI.
oauth_error: Error while authenticating against OAuth provider
access_denied: You are not allowed to access this instance
org_access_denied: You are not allowed to access this organization

require_approval.desc: Prevent malicious pipelines from exposing secrets or running harmful tasks by approving them before execution.
require_approval.none_desc: Every event triggers pipelines, including pull requests. This setting can be dangerous and is only recommended for private instances.

allowed_users.desc: Pipelines created by the listed users never require approval.

forges_desc: Configure Forges hosting repositories Woopecker should run for.
merge_ref_desc: Ref to use for merge base. This is used to determine the diff for pull requests.
git_password_desc: Password or personal access token for the Git user
skip_verify_desc: Skip SSL verification for the api connection. This is not recommended for production use.
forge_managed_by_env: The primary forge is managed by environment variables. Any changes to this forge will be reverted on a restart.
